tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE weather_patterns (
    location VARCHAR(255),
    date DATE,
    temperature FLOAT,
    humidity FLOAT,
    precipitation FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE weather_patterns (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    date DATE,
    temperature FLOAT,
    precipitation FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE climate_trends (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    year INT,
    average_temperature FLOAT,
    annual_precipitation FLOAT
);
CREATE TABLE WeatherData (   id INT PRIMARY KEY,   date DATE,   temperature FLOAT,   humidity FLOAT,   precipitation FLOAT );
CREATE TABLE WeatherRegions (   region_id INT PRIMARY KEY,   region_name VARCHAR,   latitude FLOAT,   longitude FLOAT );
CREATE TABLE ClimateModels (   model_id INT PRIMARY KEY,   model_name VARCHAR,   description TEXT,   created_date DATE );

CREATE TABLE WeatherPredictions (   prediction_id INT PRIMARY KEY,   date DATE,   predicted_temperature FLOAT,   predicted_humidity FLOAT,   region_id INT,   model_id INT,   FOREIGN KEY (region_id) REFERENCES WeatherRegions(region_id),   FOREIGN KEY (model_id) REFERENCES ClimateModels(model_id) );

CREATE TABLE weather_data (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(50),
    date DATE,
    temperature FLOAT,
    humidity FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE climate_trends (
    trend_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    trend_description TEXT,
    trend_start_date DATE,
    trend_end_date DATE,
    trend_intensity FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE future_scenarios (
    scenario_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    scenario_description TEXT,
    scenario_date DATE,
    predicted_temperature FLOAT,
    predicted_humidity FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE weather_forecasts (
    forecast_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(50),
    forecast_date DATE,
    forecast_temperature FLOAT,
    forecast_humidity FLOAT
);
